intro: Crassocephalum coeruleum, commonly known as blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant produces small blue to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, creating a mist-like appearance. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and extended blooming period. Crassocephalum coeruleum is also known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its tolerance to drought conditions.
